column4: im having trouble with a nvidia video card giving me full resolution...the max i can have is 1200 x 800 but my screen goes way higher than that...any ideas...im using nvidia 180 drivers
using buntu 9.04
you'll need to run it with: gksudo nvidia-settings
you can add lines to xorg.conf to get weird resolutions
i use command line a lot, and irc is text based so I give text based advice
i can hive you mine for reference if you wish
actually i cant as my ubuntu box is off right now :(
you can add resolutions to xorg.conf if the app will not give you the res you desire, if you websearch around you will find examples of the file which you can copy parts out of
i know
sure
ok in the subsection display in the screen section add this: Modes      "1024x768@60"
change the res to whatever you want it to do
you will need: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf    to get write access
i dont want to mess this up could you add that line to where it supposed to go and pastebin it back to me...res 1920 by 1200
http://pastebin.com/d1095b15b
maybe so but if you use a 15" CRT monitor ten it won't
you may need to tweak xorg.conf to match your monitor settings
then your xorg.conf doesnt reflect that
not sure tbh, if you search round for sample xorg.conf files using nvidia you will bump into something juicy
you may need to increase the refresh rates in the monitor section
could be the key, if you use the .run file from nvidia.com you may hit gold. I wiould make sure you uninstall all the curret nvidia stuff
